programme.title: rage Vroom Vroom Special
programme.desc: From Jamiroquai, Gorillaz, M.I.A, David Hasselhoff and more, come jump in the rage automobile and jam out to the best music videos that feature the coolest whips around.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti bring you an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Hawthorn eliminate Adelaide and the Lions beat the Suns. Plus the Storm, Panthers and Sharks win NRL Finals. Abbey Gelmi, Ellie Blackburn, Jamie Pandaram and Roy Masters cover the Wallabies and Ange Postecoglous EPL return.

programme.title: Compass
programme.sub-title: The Dj And The Gospel Choir
programme.desc: The Soweto Gospel Choir inspires audiences around the world with a powerful blend of African gospel and freedom songs. Now they join iconic Australian DJ Groove Terminator for a joyous spiritual and musical collaboration.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grow a Salad Patch and Vertical Garden
programme.desc: Costa starts a salad patch, Josh plants up a green wall, Tammy taste tests unusual citrus, Millie visits a regional community united by native plants, and we stroll through a country garden that has colour for all seasons.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Mark and Cherilyn Rice are an ambitious, well-resourced and capable couple building a four-storey modernist-style concrete, steel and glass home overlooking Mairangi Bay on Aucklands North Shore.

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Comedian Anh Do chats with one of Australias most beloved broadcasters and television personalities, Amanda Keller, as he paints her portrait.

programme.title: The Art Of Rage
programme.desc: Namila discovers rage can be a powerful motivator. Author Christos Tsiolkas, Archibald winner Del Kathryn Barton, comedian Nazeem Hussain and rapper Barkaa show how passion and fury paint a vivid picture of modern life.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers are busy rehearsing for their charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in their theatre. The investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to be centre stage.

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: Our very special concert is here! Mentored by Harry Connick, Jr. and Andrea Lam, each of our fabulous five were selected because they represent the sheer power of the piano. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Amy Greenbank, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Kate Reids croissants have been called the worlds best. But how did a Formula 1 engineer battling a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Noob Cops: The Great Fork-knife Heist
programme.desc: FREEZE! ITS THE NOOB COPS! A competition begins to crown the worlds best gamer, setting off a chain of noob crimes that lead the Noob Cops into an investigation filled with action, intrigue, and noobiness!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: After failing to open a jar Chef believes hes past his prime and entering his twilight years. This prompts Beth and the kids to dig up something from his youth to rejuvenate him.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: As Marinette thinks about her future, a supervillain shows up in Paris. Able to force people to live their childhood dreams, he turns into a nightmare for our heroes.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: After Bitzer and the Farmer stay up all night playing video games, Shaun takes advantage of their sleepiness by changing the daily tasks to suit himself.

programme.title: Speechless
programme.desc: Maya consoles Ray after his breakup with Taylor and treats him to a day out. Meanwhile, Dylan helps a nervous JJ with an upcoming friend date, and Kenneth teaches Jimmy how to be the one in charge at home.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Cringe has become its own culture online. We explore the psychology of cringe, and how it affects our public behaviour.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a snake in the lab as Dr Chris and Dr Xand explore how our body temperature works, and we bust some urban myths about how to stay healthy with new twin doctors Dan and Raph.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When a vendor at the Farmers Market sticks Panda with an EpiPen reviving him after an allergic reaction, Panda comes in to the arms of his dream girl. Panda tries to woo this woman of his dreams.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: The school principal Mr Damocles gets akumatized into Dark Owl. Armed with high-tech gadgets, he wants to get revenge on Ladybug and Cat Noir, whove humiliated him. To stop him, our heroes will have to ruffle his feathers!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Baffling Birthday
programme.desc: Ava wants to give Maudie her first proper birthday party but Maudie gets sidetracked by a mystery.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shirley drinks Bitzers fizzy pop and gets a nasty case of hiccups, but none of the cures Shaun tries seems to work. Until the Farmer takes a bath, that is...

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Derry Girls star Saoirse-Monica Jackson captains her fellow cast members Jamie-Lee ODonnell, Louisa Harland, Nicola Coughlan and Dylan Llewellyn through the mighty maze!

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Grab a Pickaxe, its Minecraft Mania!
programme.desc: Gem celebrates all things Minecraft with special guests the Fairbairn Brothers! Plus, theres a Creeper in The New Coach, a nasty surprise in Finding Player 2, and options for when youve mastered Minecraft Survival!

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts with comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie, presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell and regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil visits a two-bed terrace that is crammed with enough knick-knacks to fill an auction house. But Phil soon discovers the house isnt listed with a local agent, and its over-priced as well as over-stuffed.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.desc: For a moment, two nuclear powers seemed on the verge of war but now India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire. Over two episodes were going to look at both sides - why they want to fight, and what they have to lose.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: After discovering what he thinks is a portal, Louis must convince the rest of Dragonfly to cross over with him to see whats on the other side. However, Meg has other plans.Â

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: After Adrien tells his friend Wayhem hes not allowed to have friends over, Wayhem discovers an impromptu party at the Agrestes that makes him jealous.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Distressed Dancer
programme.desc: When his dance troupes concert routine is sabotaged, Zac hires the Inbestigators to find out who at the dance academy is responsible.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Malcolm McDowell takes the gang on a trip through time.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic: The Return Of Harmony
programme.desc: Synopsis

programme.title: Miraculous World: Shanghai, Lady Dragon
programme.desc: On the occasion of a school break, Marinette heads to Shanghai to meet Adrien... and discover her own origins.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman reunite to reflect on their adventures on "Duct Tape Island", using only the legendary tape to survive and provide a means of rescue. (Final)

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: America divided as the assassination of Charlie Kirk leads to a bitter blame game. Is this a new era of political violence? Also, Trumps extensive use of emergency powers. Plus Americas mission to return to the moon.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Julia attempts to provide solace to a prison doctor who feels guilty over death row lethal injections he performed. Pratt gets cold feet when Bettina gets serious about their relationship. Neela joins the Orthos hockey team.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig tunes in for a bit of Radio activity, asking Alan Davies, Joe Lycett, Shazia Mirza and Josh Widdicombe some impossible and interesting questions.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: Feeling the pressure to find their missing friend, Kaz tasks Louis with getting Meg back. Meanwhile, something monstrous is lurking in the woods.Â

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Marinette tries to arrange some alone time with Adrien at the wax museum, but shes supposed to be babysitting Manon, who becomes Puppeteer again.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Spoiled Sports Day
programme.desc: At the sports carnival, Kyle loses his temper when he doesnt win a race, but Maudie suspects there might be more to Kyles unexpected loss.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: The kids discover a prophecy about a figure named Canis Rex, who will unite the Doom Rock and the moonstone - and destroy the pack!

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-Six enters Fifteens Talent Show and finds some hidden talents! Learn about the number 26, and how it splits into two thirteens with the Numberblocks

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: There are so many different kinds of butterflies and we want to meet them all! From eggs to caterpillars to cocoons to wings, Clarence and the kids learn about all things butterfly and get to make their own butterfly attracting exhibit, right in the sanctuary!

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Remainders when dividing, number patterns, dividing by one.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil Spencer gives property advice to two friends struggling to sell their three-bedroom flat in south-west London. With 42 viewings and two offers that have fallen through, somethings definitely amiss.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Airbag Disaster, Heads Will Roll, Delayed Causality
programme.desc: Sit back and strap in because Brian and Jon launch this brand-new season of MythBusters with car crashes and rocket powered swords!

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include John Michael Hinton, Billy Hsueh, Shimshi and Bernardo Sedlacek.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines decide to have their dinner on the Ninky Nonk.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector makes Mole the star of her own soundtrack!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco is teaching Bing and Sula how to skip but Bing hits his leg and cant understand why Sula is better. Coco shows him that with his friends help, he can skip too!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig has a new picture of Peppa and George. Daddy Pig offers to put it up while Mummy is out. The DIY job is not as simple as he thought so Daddy Pig, Peppa and George have to mend the wall before Mummy Pig returns.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr. Gruber does a good turn for Paddington and says he can thank him by passing it on to someone else, which is harder than it sounds!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf compete to build a boat that will beat the Marigolds.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel helps Ravi at work. Ariel preps Ayanna for picture day.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters celebrate Heart-Friend Night by sending love to those far away, teaching a mermaid to fly, and using teamwork to stay safe in the forest.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds follow a garbage truck, watching bins lifted and rubbish shaken, and see how recycling turns trash into something completely new.

programme.title: PJ Masks: Pirate Power
programme.desc: Gekkos looking forward to being a pirate in a school play but his thunder is stolen by a pirate villain. Owlette accidentally helps Pirate Robot attack the Flying factory.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Caterina is all ready for a fancy tea party, but Dorothy the Dinosaur is nowhere to be seen! Luckily, Detective Lachy is on the case, and ready to follow the clues to solve the mystery of where Dorothy went!

programme.title: Mecha Builders Shorts
programme.desc: Its the Moo-sic Festival, and Zee wants to get a group photo with his drone. But when strong winds blow the drone, not everyone is in the picture!

programme.title: Lu And The Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Biba gets upset when her clay star goes missing during tidy up time.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are playing with building blocks in Bobbys bedroom but Rosa is displeased at the mess theyve made.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Koas nails are long and sharp, but hes afraid to cut them. Vida knows how to make it fun - nail polish!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Myrtle calls Stanley up to make a bike lane. Can Do! However, when surveying the area, Stanley notices a despondent Sophie without her dino costume as shes waiting for it to dry.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton leads the PJ Pets on a mission to rescue the PJMasks.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the day of the big Kangaroo Beach beach cricket match, but when Gemma and the cadets find a nest of turtle eggs, they play parents, vowing to protect the eggs from seagulls, crabs and flying cricket balls.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps Ruth fix up an old windmill into her new, energy-efficient workshop.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit is called to investigate an odd tunnel that some agents have disappeared into. When Omar insists they drive the van through the tunnel, he ends up stuck in a white void all alone and must figure how to escape.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie, Ben and Maya get carried away with their school project when they decide to build a scale model of the solar system.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the kids embark on a project to build a vertical garden on a wall to add colour and green to a space. They learn about the different plants that will thrive there.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are birdwatching with Grandpa Pig looking for birds and ticking them off in Grandpa pigs book.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Racing Rabbit
programme.desc: When the rabbits volunteer to deliver Mrs Tiggy-winkles laundry using their newly built, super fast Go-Kart, a routine delivery turns into a high speed adventure!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Paani and an injured skua are carried away by a previously undiscovered river of melting ice. Dashi and Natquik scramble to save them before they plummet down a monstrous waterfall!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo pretends to be Boss Blueys new employee in the middle of Dads backyard workout.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet an enormous ostrich, the biggest bird in the world. Then they go to feed the second animal, a penguin, and tell us all about their surprising connection.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: A mysterious jet of water, a tiddle, appears suddenly next to Igglepiggle.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Finding apples for Moles favourite pie becomes a symphony of sound at the orchard.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Pando and Sula sit in the Fire Engine but when its Bings turn; it leaves! Flop, Amma, Sula and Bing walk to Bings house where Arlo is stuck on the neighbours roof! Bing must help him get down.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George love going to the beach. They bring their water wings, a beach ball and buckets and spades. Peppa and George have fun burying Daddy Pig in the sand. When its time to go home, they almost forget Daddy Pig!

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Newton is taken prisoner by Gloop the Third and taken to Planet Gloop. The PJ Power Team treks through space on a rescue mission

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben, Holly and Gaston the Ladybird find a large egg in the meadow. A tiny chick hatches from the egg and the children must find the mummy bird.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are on the search for a new home but after all the house viewings, nothing beats their home. Peppa then suggests they extend their house instead, so the family design a bigger house together.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy sets sail around Boomerang Island in an effort to break Big Trevs record.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankies bad day worsens at the museum, but his friends teach him the value of teamwork, honesty, and leaning on others when things go wrong.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Benjamin has lost his favourite toy, Wonder Vole who helps him go to sleep at night and feel brave. Stanley helps Benjamin and Sophie look all over the house then suggests they search everywhere Benjamin had been to that day.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Its Ninas birthday party, where Eddie finds out how to play party games, eat party food, and eventually, birthday cake!

programme.title: Play School Show Time
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown introduces some native Australian animals - a ringtail possum, a blue tongue lizard and a cheeky galah named Rosie! Then get your frilled fingers ready for Chris and Rosies version of Frill Neck Lizard.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Lucia shares her love for ballet and teaches Henry the Octopus some beautiful ballet moves! The big moment arrives when Henry performs his ballet recital. Will he master the pirouette and impress The Wiggles?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Q sings I Need U, but she cant do it on her own, so unwilling U lends a hand. This episode introduces the letter Q, the pair QU and the words quack, quiz, quick and quit.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are birdwatching with Grandpa Pig looking for birds and ticking them off in Grandpa pigs book.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger teaches the baby Pea-Rexes a new survival skill through a game of hide and seek but things get out of hand when Split goes missing!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Juno cant wait for Juno-Mama Day, but Mama gets a cold. Vida teaches Juno to be a junior nurse instead!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Ari asks Stanley to clear lots of fallen leaves from the school playground. Stanley finds it harder than he thought so invents a super leaf blower which soon blows all of the leaves from the playground into his van.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko is so anxious about facing a bullying villain, that he stays home one night to avoid her.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy sets sail around Boomerang Island in an effort to break Big Trevs record.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: Chips the pufferfish isnt a confident counter, but after a special lesson from the reefs numbers genius, Mr Bwap, he gets all the confidence he needs to play hide and seek.Â

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore noodles! From pasta to pulled dough, they discover how noodles are made, cooked, and slurped in tasty dishes like stir-fries, soups, and colourful noodle bowls.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Mechas have to help when a slide sends people all the way across the farm, where they spend more time walking than sliding.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo pretends to be Boss Blueys new employee in the middle of Dads backyard workout.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children how to play Bat and Ball, she teaches them so well that they beat her at the game and win!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Apple-picking with Prestons drone goes terribly wrong, and Mojo and Bo are on the chase!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Min is re-mapping a dried-out landscape when she uncovers some sleeping caterpillars that are going to be very hungry once they wake up and find their favorite - and only - food source is gone!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo would rather explore their holiday hotel room than relax on the beach.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Oh dear, poor Norrie is sick. Can the squirrels think of something to cheer her up?

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato and the Veggies, who fall into the deli counter and come face to face with the Turnip of Terror. They escape with help from the not-so-scary Turnip.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Princesses, horses and magic wands. Bluey and Chloe can play any role they want, when they embark on an adventure to save their playground kingdom from the Greedy Queen.

programme.desc: Victorias machete bins face scrutiny over their hefty price tag. Reporters urged to embrace the beauty of a one-sided story. Plus reports on refuelling anxiety are making headlines, but is this story running on empty?

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: BTN High

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.sub-title: Vicki Brady - CEO and Managing Director of Telstra
programme.desc: Vicki Brady, CEO and Managing Director of Telstra, addresses the National Press Club on the topic "A shared national vision for Australias digital future".

programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Desperate farmers gather to tackle to impact of the drought, concerns grow over how long South Australias toxic algal bloom will last, plus a high-flying great grandmother celebrates her birthday in the clouds.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers is joined by Mark Kenny, Isabella Higgins and Greg Sheridan to discuss the PMs Pacific trip, climate policy, national security, defence spending and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price dumped from the shadow frontbench.

programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Ruby Cornish.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Donald Trump claims the US economy is hot but rock star economist Justin Wolfers says the numbers tell a different story. Plus K-beauty may be only skin deep but why South Korean cosmetics are booming down under.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Lessons learned from drought on King Island; Understanding rural Victorian discontent; and the plucky South Australian agricultural robotics company doing its own thing.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers is joined by Mark Kenny, Isabella Higgins and Greg Sheridan to discuss the PMs Pacific trip, climate policy, national security, defence spending and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price dumped from the shadow frontbench.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Italys Carlo Acutis is viewed as an internet saint: he used digital media to share his faith online. Plus thousands of university students in the Netherlands search for accommodation, which is expensive and in short supply.

programme.title: Tech Smart Agriculture
programme.desc: Australian farmers and governments spend a staggering amount of money to kill weeds. The fight relies heavily on chemical use. Queensland scientists are trying to change that. Plus their weapon of choice looks like a gun.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Concerns over escalating political violence in the wake of the shooting death of Charlie Kirk. Plus the latest on the wars in the Middle East and Ukraine, trade tariffs and the US economy as well as immigration and security.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
